page.title: 13TOURISM
page.content: LOCAL TOURISM The road along{Burrator}is heavily used by{local}people for{leisure.}The lakeside is a popular drive for Plymothians and here there are usually two ice cream vans in the summer and weekends. There is usually an ice cream van at the{parking}spot a mile beyond the cattle grid on the B3212. Along the shore of Burrator reservoir{fishing}is allowed.Both tourist from afar and locals use the moor for{hiking.}There is a "Permitted Path" along the old railway track, across the B3212 and into the Forestry Commission land on Yennadon Down. Six of the most easterly squares are not a{tourist}area.The three most westerly are.Walkhampton is not a tourist village.There is only one B&B in the village.
